contents.name: drill
contents.description: Helm Charts for deploying Apache Drill Clusters on Kubernetes
contents.title: Chart

children.value: Overridding the following two Drill configuration files is currently supported:
Please edit/replace them as needed. Please do NOT rename/delete.
Once the above configuration files are ready, please create the

configMap to upload them to Kubernetes. When a Drill chart is deployed, the files contained within this configMap will be downloaded to each container and used by the drill-bit process during start-up.
This project was originally forked from

, but
was moved to this repo for automated build and discoverability.
This repository contains a collection of files that can be used to deploy

on
Kubernetes using Helm Charts. Supports single-node
and

are a packaging format in Helm
that can simplify deploying Kubernetes applications such as Drill Clusters.
A Kubernetes Cluster (this project is tested on a
Drill Helm charts are organized as a collection of files inside the

directory. As Drill depends on Zookeeper for
cluster co-ordination, a zookeeper chart is inside the

directory. The Zookeeper chart
follows a similar structure as the Drill chart.

props.code:
drill/   
  Chart.yaml    # A YAML file with information about the chart
  Chart.lock    # A YAML file containing information about the fetched dependencies
  values.yaml   # The default configuration values for this chart
  charts/       # A directory containing the ZK charts
  templates/    # A directory of templates, when combined with values, will generate valid Kubernetes manifest files
  docs/         # A directory containing files for the documentation

children.value: Chart.yaml    # A YAML file with information about the chart
Chart.lock    # A YAML file containing information about the fetched dependencies
values.yaml   # The default configuration values for this chart
charts/       # A directory containing the ZK charts
templates/    # A directory of templates, when combined with values, will generate valid Kubernetes manifest files
docs/         # A directory containing files for the documentation

which are used to generate Kubernetes manifest files. These are YAML-formatted resource
descriptions that Kubernetes can understand. These templates contain 'variables', values for which are picked up from
the
Drill Helm Charts contain the following templates:

for providing default values to 'variables' used in the chart templates. These values may
be overridden either by editing the

. For example, such as the namespace,
number of drillbits and more to the
file for details on default values for Drill Helm Charts.

must be installed to use the charts.
Please refer to Helm's
Once Helm has been set up correctly, add the repo as follows:
If you had already added this repo earlier, run

to retrieve
the latest versions of the packages.  You can then run

There is a service that can be used, but this one will jump from pod, which isn't very unfriendly. This will be fixed in
the future. A ingress can be made to the service.

The size of the Drill cluster (number of Drill Pod replicas / number of drill-bits) can not only be manually scaled up
or down as shown above, but can also be autoscaled to simplify cluster management. When enabled, with a higher CPU
utilization, more drill-bits are added automatically and as the cluster load goes down, so do the number of drill-bits
in the Drill Cluster. The drill-bits deemed
excessive

,
by going into quiescent mode to permit running queries to complete.

used for database connection and log timestamps
Needed for the Drill Web UI.
User port address. Used between nodes in a Drill cluster. Needed for an external client, such as Tableau, to connect into the cluster nodes. Also needed for the Drill Web UI.
Control port address. Used between nodes in a Drill cluster. Needed for multi-node installation of Apache Drill.
Data port address. Used between nodes in a Drill cluster. Needed for multi-node installation of Apache Drill.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which pods are forcefully killed

webPort.description: Needed for the Drill Web UI.

userPort.description: User port address. Used between nodes in a Drill cluster. Needed for an external client, such as Tableau, to connect into the cluster nodes. Also needed for the Drill Web UI.

controlPort.description: Control port address. Used between nodes in a Drill cluster. Needed for multi-node installation of Apache Drill.

dataPort.description: Data port address. Used between nodes in a Drill cluster. Needed for multi-node installation of Apache Drill.

contents.name: zaakbrug
contents.title: Chart
ZaakBrug
contents.description: An app for Dutch municipalities that supports the transition from "zaak- en documentatieservices" (zds) to "zaakgericht werken" (zgw).

Templates used for generating zaak- and documentidentificatie
The syntax for variable substitution is as follows {[variable-name]

id          Auto-incrementing identifier with 'D' as formatting option, indicating the amount of digits.
example: {id:D5} with id-123 will result in '00123'

datetime    The current date and time with '[Y' as formatting option, according to
(
Make sure that all Url's contain two "parts" e.g.
. Openzaak can't use a single part domain.

nameOverride.description: String to partially override common.names.fullname template (will maintain the release name)

fullnameOverride.description: String to fully override common.names.fullname template

tag.description: Frank!Framework image tag (immutable tags are recommended)

memory.description: Sets the initial and maximum size of the heap that will be used by the Frank!Framework

side.description: Set the `DTAP` side of where the instance is running

secret.description: Set the secret name of the existing secret

key.description: Set the key inside the secret that contains the data (e.g. `credentials.properties`)

name.description: Set the name of the Frank! instance (default is the `fullname`)

names.description: Set the configurations to load. Leave empty to use the default

authentication.description: Set http authentication for the Frank!

localUsers.description: Set localUsers who can log in on the Frank!

baseDn.description: Set baseDn for Active Directory users

transactionManager.description: Set the transaction manager for Tomcat. Options: `NARAYANA`, `BTM`, ``

create.description: Create a `context.xml` and possibly overwrite the existing one, to configure the connections/resources.

jdbc.description: Set multiple database connections. One connection should have an empty name, so it'll get picked up by default (unless `jdbc.required=false` is set)
